newsitem.title: UK: Cadcentre to raise 7.2 mln stg for sales abroad.
newsitem.headline: Cadcentre to raise 7.2 mln stg for sales abroad.

text.p: British computer systems maker Cadcentre Group Plc on Thursday said it was planning a full listing on the London stock exchange primarily to fund sales and marketing operations overseas. The company said it was eyeing markets in eastern Europe, particularly the Czech Republic and Russia, while focusing on Malaysia and South Korea in Asia.

"The power sector is where we are aiming to be the major player since there is no dominant CAD (computer-aided design) system here," sales and marketing director Richard Longdon told a news conference.

Cadcentre develops and sells three-dimensional CAD software for processing and power plants. The firm hopes to raise 7.2 million stg via a placing of 6.34 million shares priced at 200p each and valuing the company at 33.2 million stg.
Cadcentre's finance director John Dersley said the funds will help to smooth out working capital flows.

"Turnover is a bit lumpy and that makes our profit even more lumpy. Sales tend to pick up in the last quarter, but most of our costs are people, who can't wait to be paid until the end of our year," he said.
In the year ended March 31, 1996, Cadcentre's turnover was 14.2 million stg. Profit amounted to 1.17 million stg.
The funds will also be used to redeem preference shares worth 1.8 million stg, repay a 1.9 million stg institutional loan and repay 1.5 million stg of bank borrowings.
Britain's 3i Group Plc currently owns 38.5 percent of Cadcentre, which will be reduced to 23 percent after the listing.
Dealings in the new shares is expected to commence on December 5.
